titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: Lady Selby, the wife of the late Speaker, was buried today. There was a Memorial Service in S. Margaret's conducted by me & the Archdeacon. By a singularly inappropriate choice, the special hymn was 'Onward Christian Soldiers'.
Immediately after the service there was a Committee Meeting of the Restoration Ctee at my House. Not one of them proffered a contribution toward the deficit of £207.
I had tea with Miss Hinds at Queen Anne's Mansions. Then I wrote begging letters to the Duke of Buccleugh, Lord Cheylesmore, Mr V. Cavendish, Sir Elliott Lees, & Sir John Aird.
Reichel arrived during the afternoon, & stayed the night.
Lois went to the House of Lords.
